title: Evan Williams (rugby)
text:
Evan Williams (18 June 1906 – 18 November 1976) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Aberavon%20RFC">Aberavon RFC</a> as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Centre">centre</a>, i.e. number 12 or 13, and club level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>, as a <a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>-kicking or , i.e. number 3 or 4, 6, or 7,
Background.
Williams was born in <a href="Port%20Talbot">Port Talbot</a>, Wales, he died aged 70 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International Honours.
Evan Williams won two <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> (RU) while at Aberavon RFC in 1925 against England and Scotland. Evans won his first cap aged 18 which at the time made him the second youngest player to represent Wales after <a href="Norman%20Biggs">Norman Biggs</a> in 1888.
Championship Final appearances.
Evan Williams played right-, i.e. number 3, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 2-8 defeat by <a href="Hunslet%20R.L.F.C.">Hunslet</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1937%E2%80%9338%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1937–38 season</a> at <a href="Elland%20Road">Elland Road</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 April 1938.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Evan Williams played in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 11-8 victory over <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Challenge%20Cup">1931–32</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1931–32 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 9 April 1932, and played , and scored 3-<a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s in the 18-2 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1935%E2%80%9336%20Challenge%20Cup">1935–36</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1935%E2%80%9336%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1935–36 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 18 April 1936.
Club career.
Evan Williams made his début for <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in 61-3 the victory over <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> on Saturday 7 November 1925.
Personal life.
Evan Williams' marriage to Eunice (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> John) was registered during third ¼ 1926 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> district. They had four children, Evan Rowland (birth registered during first ¼ 1927 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> district), Bryan (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DceU7qBNM43MSeOB%252FyUdNwQ%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during fourth ¼ 1929 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> North district), Barrie (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3D1tIQ7rxfPQmO7KzpGDNE4w%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during second ¼ 1932 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> North district), and Gwynneth A. (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3Dbq2wAGrYjwXNJ0BCEFt1LQ%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during fourth ¼ 1947 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> district).
